website_summaries.verdict: A great option for patio-type doors that's reliable in every way except for the sub-par tension rod.
pros: Offers sturdy screen and strong magnets in a size that works for most standard sliding and French doors
Screen feels tough and Velcro is sewn into the frame for added durability
cons: The tension rod isn't as well made as the other components, and has the tendency to slip out of place, requiring readjustment

customer_reviews.title: No enough magnets down the middle to get a good seal
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something that would keep the bugs out, but allow our dog the freedom to go in and out. It does keep the bug out for the most part, and our dog has no problem going out, but THERE AREN'T ENOUGH MAGNETS. The middle doesn't seal very well. When our dog goes in and out, there is often a large gap in the middle because the there aren't enough magnets to force it closed. Also, the bar on the top doesn't stay very well. You have to constantly re-tighten it to ensure it doesn't fall down, which it will...several times a week. Honestly, wasn't pleased at all with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher.Mom.Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, inexpensive fix.
customer_reviews.text: We got this net after getting an $800 dollar install quote for a sliding door net. We tried the as seen on tv version which was flimsy and fell apart after a week. This one is well made, takes 5 mins to install and the velcro is actually sewn onto the net not just glued making it durable. There's also a model for people who only use one side of their French doors .
customer_reviews.author: CaliforniaGirl

customer_reviews.title: The trick is to hold open the right side a second longer
customer_reviews.text: Good fit. Magnets are only in two locations, at the bottom and one third way up from bottom. Magnets are on one side only, so i had trouble getting the magnets to mate. The instructions give the solution to this problem; simply hold the right side open two seconds longer to allow the left side to fall closed first. Same procedure in and out... Found a few loose threads. The supplied white Velcro is sticky but doesn't hold well to the loop side. I ended up replacing the hook side of the Velcro with industrial type. As others have noted, the pole is easily dislodged when you walk through.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M. Paroline

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy with this screen door. It's very easy to install and it works. Please keep in mind the following: Make sure you measure the opening of the door correctly so you can order the correct size. Add to the 1-2 inches to the measurement since the screen needs some slack for the velcro portion that would be attached to the frame of the door. (See my pictures). Clean the frame of the door before installing. Install the top bar first and make sure you the screen fits properly before you peel the velcro attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: that would work better, but then why pay more for a lesser ...
customer_reviews.text: Not practical at all: The rod, which is supposed to be a tight spring-type rod capable of holding up the screen, is rigid and weak, and will NOT stay in place, and every time a person comes through the screen, no matter how gently, the rod instantly collapses onto his/her head. Thus, we never got to test whether or not it would actually keep a BUG OFF. Perhaps if you replaced that rod with a regular curtain rod from JC Penny, that would work better, but then why pay more for a lesser product from Bug Off? They should improve the rod or just sell the screen alone.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: The screen closes by folding. And there are only 3 magnets to close the screen. As I walk through the screen behind me folds the other way and the magnets don’t work. It happens 8 times out of 10. And even if the screen closes properly next time I walk through the magnets are so strong they pull the Velcro off the sides. I bought another screen for $25 and it works much better than this one. And this one costs $55!!!
customer_reviews.author: SV88

customer_reviews.title: Yes, this is the one you want.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Just put the mesh through the tension rod and put the tension rod up. Mine fits my door perfect. I suggest you measure your door because this comes in various sizes. I saw a lot of these way cheaper in price, but also cheap materials. You can see the quality. It has some Velcro on the side to seal the sides. It’s very sturdy. I really liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: If you want a durable screen this is it. I've bought screens like this for many years. I've had to replace them every few years and when I couldn't get the same one as before I went looking. I was amazed at the number of choices and the low prices. But.... you get what you pay for and after reading reviews I was sure that the cheap ones just wouldn't work for me. This screen is fantastic. Its heavy weight and the two sides overlap with good magnets. I prefer not to attach the velcro so not sure how that would hold but it works perfectly the way I use it.
customer_reviews.author: TRoss

customer_reviews.title: May not work with a two door slider
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with the quality or ease of installation. However, the opening is not positioned so that it will open and close with a two door system. the screen opens on the handle of one door making it impossible to walk through and if you do it will not close properly. I am considering returning it as a second option. I am considering shimming the door frame. My concern with that is that I think the two halves of the screen will then overlap too much to close correctly. I am not sure how this can work with a two door system. One door is stationary and the other slides. If I can contact the distributor I will ask them.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Winterhalter

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Unless You Like Throwing Your Money Away
customer_reviews.text: To say this is poorly engineered is a vast understatement. Not worth 1/10th of the price. They provide a rod that is cheap plastic that cannot hold the weight, the screen is the cheapest material they could find (likely made in China with who knows what chemical stew) and puts off an aroma that would do your local garbage dump proud, and the magnets could not hold a feather if they needed to. Clearly, Amazon does not test products that they sell here through any form of a consumer agency before they sell it on their site. Run from this product as fast as you can.
customer_reviews.author: Raygood

customer_reviews.title: Good screen, does what it supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product, way better construction and materials than some of the cheapies I’ve tried in the past. That said imho it’s pricey for what it is. I gave 4 stars for durability and adhesion because it too early to tell how long it’ll last and how well the adhesive will stick over time.
customer_reviews.author: Rocksnsalt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: My friend recommended me to get a screen same as his, but I found I need a large size which that brand does not offer. I did some research and found this one. It probably is the most expensive one among all others brands. However, after installing it, I see why. The quality is totally different from my friends one, and it also looks much better. Not sure if it has anything to do being NOT MADE IN CHINA, it does surprise me and my friend by its quality. I think it worth to pay more to get a quality product like this one. Oh, by the way, it only took me 5 minutes to get it installed and working.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: I love this screen.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one so dogs could easily go in and out on nice days and I could keep the flies and mosquitoes out. I don't use the adhesive tabs on the sides. That way it's easier for my little dogs to walk through. People go through by pushing one side forward and going through. Much easier for people to use than a screen door. I liked it so much I bought two more for other doors to the patio and backyard. It is very easy to hang and stays in place. I've had the first one over a year. It's just like new.
customer_reviews.author: S. SHEA

customer_reviews.title: Magnets lost their magnetism in less than 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: The screen has been up for just a little under 3 months now. At first it was great, but the magnets that hold the screen closed don't work anymore. They have lost their magnetism and the product is now worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Durable and very easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this screen for over a year and it has endured countless exits/entries by 4 dogs, 2 cats, and multiple humans! Since installing this screen, we leave our door open to the back yard whenever we are home and the weather is nice (we're in CA so that is quite often). I am purchasing a replacement today (14 months later) due to the bottom starting to fray a bit. With the extremely high use this screen received, I am very happy with how long it lasted. I also very much appreciate that the installation is cosmetically friendly and did not cause damage to our newly painted door frame. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: we now have a perfect solution for our odd glass entry
customer_reviews.text: At first the rod sagged in the middle because it has to attach to walls much further apart than the door opening for the glass door in the entry. The middle of the screen would not close because the small rod had to stretch 72" to go against a wall. I found a thicker shower rod the right length that does not sag in the middle and the screen now magically closes perfectly by itself! Even when our dog goes through! With careful attaching of the sticky tape & velcro for the sides, we now have a perfect solution for our glass entry with the odd 42" pivoting glass door but with perpendicular walls that are 72" apart.
customer_reviews.author: Alex L. Shelton

customer_reviews.title: USA mesh does not mean made in USA.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the most expensive screen to avoid problems. First, the product is not US made. They sell it based on door size when it should be based on door frame width Instructions don't have enough detail, so I had to try different ways of mounting until it kind of works. If it was wide enough to mount flat to door frame, it would probably close better. It works good about half the time. The adhesive is strong so in the process I removed spots of paint. Looks durable, but not woth $56. I would pay $35.
customer_reviews.author: Amir T.

customer_reviews.title: Great screen if you do not need or want a permanent solution (renters this is for you!!)
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with my purchase - I have nice french doors off my living room opening to a patio, but learned the hard way bugs do come up to the 2nd floor. I was looking for affordable screen door options and this instant screen looked like a good idea. Received my screen today, set it up in 10 minutes and it's fits great. I can see that the magnets do not come together every time, but that's okay with me - it's not a custom screen so I do not expect it to be a perfect screen, but overall I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Bug Door Ever!
customer_reviews.text: We love our bug off screen door! The middle opening magnetic closing combined with the shower-rod style bar at the top makes these far superior to the other screens out there. Trust me, we tried the others, but searched hi and low to find these bug off doors - the durability and convenience they offer more than offsets a slightly higher cost vs. the cheaper stuff made overseas.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality screen
customer_reviews.text: This fit our French doors to our deck well. Screen and magnets are good quality and I expect it will last many seasons. It is installed with a rod pushes into the door frame (similar to a shower curtain) which works fine and makes installation super easy but I'd prefer something that attaches to the frame on the outside because there is a tiny gap at the top in spots where the rod doesn't quite sit flush with the frame. The bracket to place in the middle does help but isn't perfect. We are pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: ThetaHokieMommaBear

customer_reviews.title: Portable screen "bug off"
customer_reviews.text: It did not meet my expectations in the east. I am very disappointed, and would have sent it back. I may still. The Velcro is a little heavy to push through the screen, and the bar has slipped already. I will need it taken down completely when my friend arrives to assist.
customer_reviews.author: lilysmom

customer_reviews.title: Minor issues with size
customer_reviews.text: Works as temporary screen until we replace the sliding door and screen door. This does not fit our 47x79 patio door well. But it was the best option that has the adjustable rod at the top. This size is actually for 49x82, it leaves a gap at the bottom for our door and the magnet doesn’t stick properly because of the stiff fabric there (even after cutting out some material to make the bottom edge have a smaller gap). For the price, a couple more magnets would have been nice, sometime the one magnet in the center doesn’t catch to close without some assistance. I had to buy more magnets to help with the closure.
customer_reviews.author: Lienna.T

customer_reviews.title: something to keep the birds out
customer_reviews.text: we didn't want to install a screen door, we just needed something to keep the birds from flying into the house, let the dogs go to the deck and look nice. High quality , perfect weights at bottom, nice size and good looking magnetic closure in middle and a simple but well done rod to use. so happy!
customer_reviews.author: Michele Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Buy one almost every year!
customer_reviews.text: I have dogs ... big dogs! This is great for them and us on my big slider out to my deck. Hands full with stuff for the grill? No problem ... back through the screen! Doggies can go in and out and the bugs stay out. The only reason I need to buy one almost every year is my dogs do damage if the glass door is closed, the screen is on the outside and so are they and the want to come in and get all crazy pawing on the screen. I try not to do that often. No fault of the screen, their claws are nasty sharp. Shame on me for not trimming them more often!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Martino

customer_reviews.title: Screen does not close well
customer_reviews.text: The magnets on this screen are pretty inadequate. I have another screen from another company on my front door and the magnets do a great job of closing the screen. I bought some more magnets to attach to this screen door in an attempt to mimic the other one I own, but I wasn’t able to attach them well enough. We’ve resorted to leaving the glass door mostly closed so that one half of the screen overlaps it which works pretty well. I had quite a few mosquito bites before we figured out what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Olive Oyl

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Especially good for temporary installation
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a soft screen door to keep bugs from coming in through open French Doors. I read all the reviews and decided to go with the Bug Off screen. After using it for a couple of weeks, I'm very pleased with the decision. Pros -- Can be installed in a couple of minutes without covering the door frame with adhesive-backed velcro Spring-loaded rod holds the screen firmly in place and allows for small differences in door frame width Easily removable Cons-- The two sets of magnets that keep the screen closed aren't 100% effective and sometimes don't release or close properly. I'd love to see Bug Off adopt the continuous woven-in magnets of some competitors
customer_reviews.author: K. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Best decision we made re: mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: We bought one for the front door & one for the sliding door. Great! Keeps out 99% of the mosquitoes. Watch the YouTube(?) video for installation & use tips including how to get your dog to use it. We found it's key to make sure the bottom hem just barely skims the floor or else it won't auto close correctly. Actually, it stretched a little over the first 1-2 weeks so we took it down and put it back up using the lower of the 2 tension bar guide channels. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: arlington shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the same as the ones I have purchased over the last several years. It is awesome. Easy to enter and exit our screened porch by humans and quad-peds. We typically replace every 2-3 years because it is kept up year round through 4 seasons in the midwest.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a best selling screen that did not work for our door ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a best selling screen that did not work for our door and was way too complicated with the velcro and tacks! This one is on a rod that attaches in the door jamb...so I as a person who is not good at installing, was able to install it myself without help from my hubby:D Easy to use, wish there were a few more magnets and they magnetized on both sides. When you enter through it if the flaps swing a certain way, the magnets don't attach when they flap the wrong direction. Otherwise, quite pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Odi

customer_reviews.title: Best screen ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best screen we've had! I bought one five years ago and it finally gave out after thousands of ins and outs from our furbabay, so I was hoping Amazon still sold them. This has 2 big magnets positioned in the center and on the bottom. The hold and coverage is great. We've tried the ones with the many magnet all down the middle and it did not work as well. I really love the tension rod holding the screen "curtain" that makes for very easy installation! Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dennie

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: I have been using different versions of these screens for years and have always modified them to work with a tension rod. This product makes it so much easier - for the side adhesion I substituted On Command velcro so as not to leave glue on the door frame. Very Happy
customer_reviews.author: cb

customer_reviews.title: A must if you have dogs! And EASY to install!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! If you have doors with no screens, you HAVE to get this. I have two dogs and they constantly go in and out, and in and out. This was my life saver. It's like a shower curtain spring rod. I'm a true girl's girl and don't install anything without a guy's help. But, I did this on my own. Just measured the width of my door frame and ordered the closest thing to it. Whah-lah.....it couldn't have been any easier. And I figured out that the tenants before me must have had the same thing b/c I can see the marks where the same thing was placed. Trust me, you'll love this if you have dogs!
customer_reviews.author: beachinitisme

customer_reviews.title: This one Works!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several of this type of bug screen but none compare to this one. I really like it. I have French Doors that open out so I got this to put on the inside of the door. It is very easy to hang and adjust. It has an adjustable length because there are two slots for the rod to go thru changing the length by 1/2 or so. The material is very good quality and feels sturdy yet you can easily see through it. Keeps the bugs out ! The dog figured it out on the first try. Definitely recommend this product and I am getting another.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My door is 33X80 but that option is not offered. I went to the manufactures website and read that you can use 1 inch smaller sizes by following their directions, so I figured I would take a chance. I must say this fits perfectly in the door and I am very pleased. I would absolutely recommend this to somebody else. I have wanted something like this for over a year so needless to say running across this was exactly what I was looking for and the fact that it's perfect, I win!
customer_reviews.author: K. Shustak

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good product. It lasts 1-2 years
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good product. It lasts 1-2 years, but we use it often and take it down at least twice a week. My only issue is that I asked them to replace one of the velco attachments that was defective when it arrived. They never responded (perhaps they didn't receive), and I never received a replacement. We ordered from them multiple times in the past, so disappointed that they did not send a replacement velco piece. Other than that, it's a good buy. Keeps out the bugs and allows my cats to go in and out of the house into the fenced-in yard without the bug issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ekn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for the back patio sliding glass door except ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for the back patio sliding glass door except The screen doesn't always close automatically behind you and when it closes the magnets in the middle sometimes don't line up. Could have been made with magnets that go all the way down the opening from top to bottom. I have a screen but different brand for a standard door and there are magnets that line the opening from top to bottom so makes opening and closing a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Rayza cano

customer_reviews.title: quick screen for porch doors
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these years ago and really liked it. The tension rod makes it easy to install and put wherever you want it. It has several tape tabs with Velcro to hold sides to wall. The one I got was a little long but it flows nicely and covers the space I need sealed. I am pleased with it. Better than the ones that use magnets.
customer_reviews.author: Troizana

customer_reviews.title: Installation was easy and unlike other products
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. Installation was easy and unlike other products, it was easy to install with enough tension to not fall out of the door jam. Magnets for closing the two halves work well although every so often they would stick to the open metal door we have between the garage and home. But this is not a knock. Used it only for the day for a party we were having. The side Velcro tabs also were useful but only exposed a third of the adhesive as to remove at the end of the day. Reapplied the plastic to cover adhesive. Well made and look for it to be around for many years. No complaints, good design and worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: DougM

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: The mesh is strong and the install was super fast. I have to maneuver a specific way with a laundry basket to get through it. There are gaps in the center and sides often. (I did measure the door and it does fit well). Sometimes it doesn't close, the center magnet either isn't strong enough or it could use a couple more magnets. The sides need more velcro too. My husband & I prefer the #1 Premium Magnetic Screen though it was twice the price. For the money this one is ok. If you have some extra velcro for the sides & some magnets to add you can hack this to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Urbano

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pet Solution for Sliding doors !
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2, one for upstairs and one for downstairs. Love everything about them—Perfect height for 8’ opening, ease of installation, Magnetic tabs keeps screens In place while keeping bugs out. Most importantly My pups can move freely from indoors to outdoors whenever they need to :)
customer_reviews.author: Abi T.

customer_reviews.title: velcro sticky tabs are not enough, otherwise great!
customer_reviews.text: this is our second screen, and it works great. The magnet stitching wore off after three seasons so it was time for a new one. This time we bought the velcro extreme strips because the little velcro tabs that are included are not enough to hold the screen in place.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly Grant

customer_reviews.title: perfect for California hot summers
customer_reviews.text: got this for french doors and its fantastic ! we now can let fresh air in without the mosquitios and flies. Easy to put up, honestly took me 10 mins and tadahhhh. Great customer service also, I had to return a smaller one that didnt fit and they made it so easy and where so quick.
customer_reviews.author: Irishred

customer_reviews.title: Good But Not Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this needing to replace screen door that I walked through and bent beyond repair. When product was received it looked promising but after having it up for 2 weeks now I've discovered a few flaws with the design. First of all the tension rod at the top of the screen slides down causing the fabric to droop. Secondly the magnets are quite large and solid so when my large dog goes through the screen the magnets bang against the class of the sliding door. I'm afraid they might break the glass. I does work weel keeping the flies out and is easy to walk through when you hands are full of food or BBQ stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Chile1960

customer_reviews.title: It is much better than a sliding screen door
customer_reviews.text: It is much better than a sliding screen door, as my dog can come and go. However, it needs to be 2 inches wider, to facilitate better closure with the velcro edges. Also wish it wasn't so stiff, as if it hangs over the threshold, you cannot close the door. This is my second one - got three years out of the previous instant screen - it became shredded from the dog scratching on it to come in.
customer_reviews.author: HACCP Auditor

customer_reviews.title: A Super Idea that Works as Shown!
customer_reviews.text: This instant screen is so simple to install and heavy weight is beneficial. Much better than those cheapo ones you see on TV which don't stick to the sides of your door frame. The idea of making it go over a tension bar was ingenious. Thinking of getting another for a different door.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Em

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't look quite as clean as it does in the pictures.  Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: In terms of this type of screen, this is probably the best you're going to get. In terms of aesthetics, I am not a big fan of the product, the top of it has that fringe look like curtains do.. This is a screen, not a curtain so I'd rather it not have that look. The clasps are very strong, and despite the fact that people walk right through it in the video i've found that you still need to grab it and seperate it before walking through. Install is super easy with the tension rod. I just wish it looked a little cleaner and was easier to walk through.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Klaproth

customer_reviews.title: It's not one size fits all
customer_reviews.text: You have to have a perfect application and size door for this to make sense. We have out-swing french doors to a covered patio. It just doesn't work. It's too tall no matter what for a standard door opening height-wise. Good idea, poor application for us.
customer_reviews.author: germanelegance

customer_reviews.title: returned
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't stay attached to the door. Kept falling down and scaring the dogs. Definitely didn't work for pets as the picture showed. Our dog isn't that big (Scottish terrier), so pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John D Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Clever design and works really well
customer_reviews.text: We like this and though I should probably get a screen door, I prefer my pretty big wood door with no screen. So we got this and with kids and a dog it holds up very well. Definitely keeps the bugs out if you line it up right. Rolls up easily and I hide under my couch next to the front door.
customer_reviews.author: LORD BYRON!!

customer_reviews.title: Luv it
customer_reviews.text: My sliding glass door screen kept getting stuck in popping out it was driving me crazy. Was very skeptical about this. But this thing works quite well my dog and also my cats learned very quickly how to walk out onto my lanai using it and it fits pretty well. I do agree with what people say about it’s really important that you measure accurately it won’t really lay right and it’ll probably gab if you order it too long or not the right size there’s not a lot of room for adjustment but other than that I absolutely love it
customer_reviews.author: Kat FL

customer_reviews.title: Buy the 19.99/same
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why this particular screen was 75.00? I have another one with just Velcro and looks exactly the same except for the bar at the top. The tension bar at the top is not worth the 50.00 more than the other Velcro types not sure if I’m going to keep it ?
customer_reviews.author: Theresa A.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is perhaps the 5th Bug off screen I've purchased. It is a great product. I find that they last me about 2 seasons (due to large dogs!) .
customer_reviews.author: Peter Bossard

customer_reviews.title: great solution if you have a few bugs
customer_reviews.text: No banging door, Pets can come and go, durable. We have used the screen for 2 years I expect it will last 8 or 10 more. We did need to staple the Velcro to the wood door frame. A few bugs can get past the screen so I wouldn't recommend it for real buggy areas.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M

customer_reviews.title: SO much better than the ones you need to attach to the door frame
customer_reviews.text: Installed in 2 minutes and it's easy to take down/move to another door. Mesh appears to be thick, good quality. I recently installed it so not sure how well it will last. Seems solid though. Magnets are strong,.
customer_reviews.author: LittleItaly

customer_reviews.title: NO FLAWS
customer_reviews.text: Works great!! I noticed a few reviewers had written that the stabilizer pole falls easily. That is either because #1 - They didn't follow the directions... or #2 - The spring in the pole is missing or malfunctioning. NOTHING is pulling that thing down, short of someone hanging on it! My dog and young children picked up on how to properly use it right away. I don't find it necessary to buy extra sticky-tape velcro, like some people have stated. But if you live in a really "buggy" climate, you may find it helpful. I wish I had bought this a long time ago!
customer_reviews.author: Jbllm

customer_reviews.title: It does it's job well and it was super easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an instant screen but then realized that the dimensions were too short so I went with this company instead. They offer many different sizes which is a huge plus. It would defeat the purpose of putting these up if they are too short. It does it's job well and it was super easy to put together. Has velcro you stick to the sides of the door frame so it stays in place. All in all I would say this is a good investment if you don't want to buy a full on screen door.
customer_reviews.author: C. Joo

customer_reviews.title: Good from far, but far from good...
customer_reviews.text: Good from far but far from good. Most airborne critters will probably stay out but there's insufficient blockage at the top or bottom depending upon installation. The center bracket is crucial for stability ("optional in instructions"). This thing kept falling down without it. The magnets aren't great (but I knew that from previous reviews). "Closes perfectly every time" is incredibly dishonest. Great idea in theory but I suppose I was dreaming for great upon arrival. Simply "okay". Pretty disappointed. I would've returned it had I not thrown the box out after opening. My fault. $50 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Evan B.

customer_reviews.title: A great alternative to a screen door. Don't bother with the cheaper ones - this one is worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one of these - we really rate it! Several of our friends have bought these after seeing ours. We needed to buy extra double sided foam tape for the second season of use and to replace some that had lost its stickiness. The dog finds it much easier for going in and out. However sometimes she loses her temper with it when she is on a mission to chase squirrels so she ripped the first one with her teeth. Even then she only made some small holes. The main reason I bought another was I lost it in the garage over winter!
customer_reviews.author: Salmotrutt

customer_reviews.title: I love it and it works great for us
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our dog to be able to go in and out from our sliding door onto our deck and backyard. I love it and it works great for us. It's slightly too big for our door and hangs a little long and awkward at the bottom, causing the magnets not to match up, but we make it work. It is only held up by a tension rod and velcro, so when my pup comes flying through the screen, she does pull it down, but it's an easy fix to tighten back up. For the price, it's fine and does the job. Dog can get in and out easily, keeps bugs out, lets the breeze in.
customer_reviews.author: Munchkinmom

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product but price is a bit steep
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the same item two years ago and it worked very well. It just got beat up with a lot of traffic of dogs & people. The price has increased quite a bit in the past two years. I would have purchased a couple more for different doors but sadly it would have been too costly. It does work beautifully though.
customer_reviews.author: Meryl

customer_reviews.title: Fine quality door
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this screen door is excellent. Unfortunately it is just 2" too narrow for my doorway. I have to look for a wider one that is just as tall. I advise getting a solid line of velcro tape around your opening. Otherwise, the wind will pick up an edge and create a big gap.
customer_reviews.author: A. Panos

customer_reviews.title: works and is a good value to keep bugs out.
customer_reviews.text: It works to keep the bugs out. However getting through it proves to be a bit difficult. We use it on the door to the deck for regular traffic. you have to kinda roll through the center opening. My dog has it down pat but me not so much. Every now and then I end up waliking backworads through it to keep it from knocking off my dinner from its plate.
customer_reviews.author: Steven the Poncho

customer_reviews.title: Works great, sturdy yet lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Works great, sturdy yet lightweight, and the installation couldn't be simpler. I've had a similar screen in the past but the Velcro system at the top didn't hold properly and it lost it's shape. This Bug Off Instant Screen closes itself and stays closed with the magnets provided to keep the bugs out, yet is light enough that both my 80lb+ German Shepherd Dog and my 7lb Maltese have no problem maneuvering so I can spend my time doing things other than providing "doorman" services to my dogs! I've already referred to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L

customer_reviews.title: It's great for letting in the fresh air but not the ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised and just what I wanted for my patio French door. DO MEASURE the door opening. These are sized very specifically. The design is so simple it's genius, using a tension rod for hanging, unlike cheaper versions. The screening material is very heavy weight, high quality. The bottom is weighted too which keeps it in place. I sans'd using the Velcro because my door frame is painted. They're unneccessary anyway. I wouldn't use it unsupervised with small children as it could fall if pulled on. Also it's not intended as a doggy door. It's great for letting in the fresh air but not the bugs!
customer_reviews.author: KDK in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Best one so far
customer_reviews.text: A million times better than those cheap velcro only ones. This was easy to install, lines up perfectly and the magnets are strong. Only negative fire me is that the weighted bottom gets hooked on the threshold on the door which means we have to constantly make sure it closes. I'm sure this could be fixed by rolling it up a little higher but then that will mess with the velcro on the sides. I wish this was mentioned in the set up.
customer_reviews.author: Kdiddle

customer_reviews.title: Bug Stopper
customer_reviews.text: The screen works well enough however it's held up by a friction rod that will not stay in place over use. My dogs love it as they can come and (a blessing and a curse in our world) go as they please. I'd like to see more magnetic attachments on the screen to provide improved closure. The screen closes okay, however open gaps happen and a magnet that ran the length of the screen's opening would solve that. The friction rod is an okay solution, however again I'd rather see an alternative mounting system that eliminates the need to constantly adjust the rod or supply a rod that isn't quite so feeble.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in July 2018, didn't' touch it till today Oct 11, 2018 and found out i ordered the wrong size. I don't know how to exchange it. so i folded it back into its original box. But it loos very durable. Am impressed. Is there a way i can email the seller to exchange it for me Pleaaaaaaas?
customer_reviews.author: emma

customer_reviews.title: This is My 5th One!!! So Squeaky(My Cat)...Can Go In & Out!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this solution for my back door so Squeaky and now her kitties(who have been fixed) can go in and out of the house...makes life so easy without letting in those pesky mosquitos, flies, etc...2 caveats..1. Upon entering or leaving my house, I pull either the left side or right of the screen v. using the center split ...2. also the mesh does shear /w/ time(wear & tear) of any product...that is why I am ordering a new one...about every 2 years...you all know with kitties how they like to go in and out...this screen eliminates that play with the kitties..."do you want to go out or stay in?"...they can now do their own thing!!!!
customer_reviews.author: thewinechairman

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well, strong magnets!
customer_reviews.text: This screen works very well as the magnets are really strong! We get occasional breezes here in Hawaii and this screen closes despite the breeze b/c magnets are really strong. My dogs love the screen too and just took a few seconds to figure out that they can go in and out as they please.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Pakozdi

customer_reviews.title: This screen is attractive and works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: This screen is attractive and works like a champ. Accept no substitutes! We had one for five years. We tore it. Couldn't remember which brand, and bought a different one (at Bed, Bath & Beyond). It was garbage. It used only adhesive velcro to stay in place. Our pets tore it down in 5 minutes. Also it was bulky and ugly. This one uses a tension rod, with velcro just along the sides. It works perfectly. Pets and people can go in and out, bugs stay out. It hangs nice and straight, looking very unobtrusive. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: DMF

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this screen. I purchased a different screen a few months ago and it was such a pain to hang up, not to mention the eyesore that it became. I could tell that the screen wouldn't last but I had no idea that its useful life would be only a few weeks. I just received this screen today and it took me all in all less than a minute to hang up. Quality material and looks great on our door. Don't go for the cheap screens, save your money and purchase this one!
customer_reviews.author: mamaow

customer_reviews.title: Removable Screen Door
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I rent and could not install a screen door. This is a great alternative so I can leave the deck door open to get a nice breeze but keep the flys out. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: I. Lohneiss

customer_reviews.title: So far - dog tested and larger screen has worked better
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to cover a sliding door. Our very energetic medium size dog comes and goes without pulling the screen down. I've bought others in the past, and here's some advice. We never had any luck with the sides sticking to the door jam for any length of time, so we don't bother. We also have bought a size that covers the whole door jam, and come and go by going through the side flap verses going through the magnet slit in the middle. The larger screen has done a better job in keeping bugs out, and has made it easier to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer52

customer_reviews.title: I like the variety of sizes it comes in
customer_reviews.text: I like the variety of sizes it comes in. Ours fits the door just right. It's a bit awkward walking through it, as you have to use your whole body to get out. The magnets click back together easily going in one direction, but you have to re-connect them when going back the other way. The tension rod slips a bit with usage, but the overall, this is perfect for our needs. It's an excellent alternative to purchasing an expensive screen door.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bug Off Screens exceeded our expectations!
customer_reviews.text: This product has exceeded our expectations! We purchased 2 sets of screens for 2 outswing french doors at The Lodge on Palomar Mountain. The shipment came sooner than promised, and we got them just in time as there was an unexpected heat wave PLUS the flying insects are out in full force! The screens are super easy to install and go up in minutes. We had a large group at The Lodge and the guests were able to stay comfortable, keep the doors open and the insects OUT! Thank you - I will definitely recommend Bug Off screens to others and am going to purchase another set for our primary residence at the coast.
customer_reviews.author: Diana S

customer_reviews.title: Best design by far!
customer_reviews.text: Bug Off uses an adjustable rod system that makes it easy to put up or take down. In my opinion this is far superior then the others that you have to adhere across the top and sides. I purchased one about 7 years ago, and still use it. We recently moved and I have two additional doors that needed screens and bought two more. I highly recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rechten

customer_reviews.title: VERY DURABLE
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would give a shout out 3 years later. It's still in fantastic shape!!! It has survived the grand kids running through it and knocking it down several times. No damage!!! This is a very well made product and fits our French doors perfect. Well worth the $ 😁
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: No Flies In The House!
customer_reviews.text: The screen works great. The edges line up perfectly and seal tightly. We no longer have any fly issues when it is cool enough to leave the front door open! Would purchase again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Neon

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in the beginning. We were so pleased. But didn't last very long, before. Had to start trying to keep it sticking to the door jams. I used Velcro strips and this worked for a bit. Tried command hooks, but just could not get them to stay. Bummer because when it worked, it was great!
customer_reviews.author: BRY

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful with Your Measurements
customer_reviews.text: The product didn't fit my standard front door properly and I measured my door twice. I'm forced to make adjustments (folding and cutting) to make it look 'just okay'. I ordered the Magnetic Screen Door at the same time for my patio door and installed it without any difficulties. The Magnetic Screen Door is cheaper and has more magnets to keep it closed.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole78023

customer_reviews.title: Long term review with pets
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice attempt to get a screen door up quickly but it's not a long term replacement for a real screen door. We used this in from of our glass door and our Beagle pup attempting come in (with glass door closed) would scratch it and torn up the bottom of the mesh. The hanging rod would fall off every so often and you have to re-adjust the rod tension. Finally, as others have complained the velcro is just not a good way to hold the sides. Ours keeps coming off and the adhesive is no longer stick. We constantly had to deal with these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Delsol999

customer_reviews.title: I got the same Bug Off like the first one and it's perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Bug Off screen I buy, the first one lasted 4 years until my hubby walked inside thru it with a plate of barbecue and a knife and the knife damage the screen. I got the same Bug Off like the first one and it's perfect. So fast to install, it took me five minutes, fits perfectly, it's convenient because my dog knows how to go in and out. No more bugs and great breeze comes in the kitchen. I can come and go fast with barbecue, plates and drinks, but no knife.
customer_reviews.author: Creek

customer_reviews.title: Good price. Good alternative to retractable screen door.
customer_reviews.text: Needs more magnets in the middle. More magnets would make it difficult to close/open, but it lacks a magnet in the top half. It also needs more Velcro on the sides. I had to add Velcro on the sides to keep bugs from getting inside. It's a great alternate to a retractable screen door. Easy installation. My med/lrg dogs haven't figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Get on with more magnetic closures
customer_reviews.text: Love how it covers the space but two magnets does not hold it closed. I spend more time pressing and overlapping the 2 magnets more than being happy a mosquito is not chapping me. I am going to put on more Velcro closures.
customer_reviews.author: acohenphd

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic screen for French patio doors.
customer_reviews.text: This fits exactly how I wanted it to look on my double French patio doors. The picture is accurate and the screen is not dark where you can't look outside and enjoy the scenery. The mesh is the same shade as a regular window screen, but sturdier. Wish I bought this sooner as I spent too much on cheaper ones. Sometimes cheaper isn't better.
customer_reviews.author: Oldies Lover

customer_reviews.title: Works for us
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 cats, a dog, and a preschooler that likes to run in and out. Our tall door is difficult to find a screen door for and honestly I didn't want to pay the money to have one installed when the occupants would just bang it open and shut. This fit our needs perfectly. The cats, dog, and kids have figured out how to work it. No more bugs on my ceiling and the door stays open. The velco is working on my door, but adding more may be fine too. The magnets work well and the weighted bottom seems study enough.I also like that during the cold months I can just take it down and it away.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica of San Jose

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for our French Door
customer_reviews.text: Our previous screen was old and had a few holes through deuteriation. The new screen is much stronger and more durable material. The adhesive fixtures seem quite strong. The velcro connectors do not easily disconnect from the screen itself. The biggest challenge has been our dog learning to go through the middle of the screen instead of the side! We really enjoy the twisting action to tighten the screen spindle in our doorway. This way we can loosen and store away in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M James Bentzler

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work like the video.
customer_reviews.text: Concept was good, Too bad it doesn't work. The magnets never snapped together on their own as in the video. We got this so we did not have to open the door for our 130lb Mastiff every time he wanted to go out or refused to come in. However, we have to constantly go and manually align the magnets to the screen will close. It's better than leaving the door open with no screen at all, however. Good thing I have an electronic bug zapper.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Okay but size issue
customer_reviews.text: This product is okay. It does not appear to be flimsy and seems like it will hold up, however, I don't think the size is correct. I measured the door frame as 31 x 80. the 32" part is just about an inch too wide, so that makes sense, it is 32" when I needed 31". BUT, the length does not even come close to completely filling the doorway. I am making due with it, but it's not as long as it says it is.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: not strong enough!
customer_reviews.text: Only one magnet in the center of the screen, maybe 2in and the ones at the bottom to weight it down, don't! If there is the slightest wind the screen just flaps and you have to constantly manually adjust it to close it. This is also my second one.. First one I returned. Ordered it in the size for my door, and the magnets didnt even touch and you felt like the whole thing would fall down, very awkward walking through it. Now I got this one slightly bigger, and it still sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: It is a great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: It is a great product for the money. However, buy extra Velcro because the attached ones are not enough to maintain a tight fit against the door. Make sure you purchase extra strength Velcro. On frequent use you will need to close the magnets for yourself. It is easy for your pets to go through and it keeps the bugs at bay. We specifically purchased it because we wanted our pets to come and go at their leisure without the hassle of the bugs. Great purchase especially if you don't want to get a screen door.
customer_reviews.author: MsAshleigh

customer_reviews.title: it works great when it doesn't fall off....
customer_reviews.text: I had to eventually put 2 little nails on top to hold it, it really tends to fall off... otherwise I love it
customer_reviews.author: Susanne Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Better than any other i tried
customer_reviews.text: After ordering other brands of these temporary screens, i stumbled on this one, and it is far and away better than all the others that i returned. For my needs anyway. It has the expandable pole at the top which is what i wanted because i didnt really want velcro on my new sliding door. So i use the pole at the top and its weighted enough that it stays right where i put it. It does its job.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Very practical and good quality...and really easy to hang
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Bug Off screen. A new dog did the old one in while learning how to use it. I had the two of them for eight years. They can take a pretty good beating as they are made to give and get out the way when anyone....or anything is going through. This is a very practical way to have screen on the French doors in the summer and put away in winter. The new one seems even better than my first two. This product has been time tested and improved.
customer_reviews.author: Elphy 2

customer_reviews.title: So probably good for a door you don't plan on walking through
customer_reviews.text: When arrived magnet was half ripped off, I am so tired of returning things I decided to glue it and put it up anyways. However the bar that is used to hold it up, constantly comes loose so when walking through it falls down often. It lasted about two weeks before we got tired of fixing it. It did keep any bugs out in the mean time. So probably good for a door you don't plan on walking through.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt snap back in place well
customer_reviews.text: This product is described as being a good solution for letting pets in and out but owing tomits design it is really not. Closure requires that left panel be in place before right one comes closed in order for magnets to overlap correctly. Not too many dogs can be trained to do that! This means you have to constantly rearrange the two panels to allow the screen to close well. Also had to order and glue on extra magnets. My faighter has a Magic Mesh screen that works much better than my Bug Off with regard to closing itself.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S. Foil

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second bug off screen! Great quality, heavy duty and long lasting. I like that it is held up by a tension rod, instead of putting it up with a sticky velcro product. Its heavy enough to not get blown around by the wind, but not too heavy that you can not see through it.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia R.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, but doesn't close well when I walk through it. I have to sometimes use my foot to close it, or hands. I also used a staple gun to secure it better to the door, since bugs were getting in just as bad as leaving the door open without it being secured well. But, once it was secured and as long as I make sure the magnets click together when I open or close it my dogs can go in and out and I get amazing air flow! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing... but not much.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, but only two magnet spots. Flies always seem to buzz along it until they slide between the two panels and voilà! You now have flies trapped on the inside. Another minor complaint is that the way it is constructed it seems to be a tight fit for my head (I'm 6'2") when I walk through and I always find myself ducking. There are brands with magnets all the way up and down the opening, I would suggest those instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jon E Rietveld

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and fell apart
customer_reviews.text: My sister has on that works great and is made stronger, however, I don't know the brand.
customer_reviews.author: LaurelOlivia

product_meta.title: Bug Off 72 by 80 Instant Screen, Fits Some French Doors and 12-Foot Sliding Glass Doors
product_meta.description: Size:72 Inch x 80 InchEnjoy year round insect protection with the revolutionary walk-through, auto-close, Hands Free Screen Door. The Bug Off Hands Free Screen Door is the solution for parties and barbecues, providing hands free entry and exit for you, family, guests, and pets. Keep bugs out while letting fresh air in. The magnetic auto-close feature automatically shuts the screen each time you walk through it. It fits French Doors and sliders, plus can be installed in apartments, rentals, and condos. This is a great alternative to expensive custom screens and annoying sliding screens that come off the track. The Hands Free Screen is built with easy height and width adjustment, with 2 height adjust tunnels at the top allowing for installation on odd size doors.
feature_bullets: Don't be fooled - Works better and lasts longer than the cheaper instant screens - We've tested them all
Made with USA Mesh and Magnets for superior durability and performance. - Installs without tools in 5 minutes
Keeps bugs out of your home without hassle - Works for people and pets
Provides magnetic hands-free entry and exit - No more slamming screens, or screens left open
14 Standard sizes - Save hundreds screening your French doors and tall doors

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,652 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
